intro: Bryodesma × neomexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican bryodesma, is a hybrid plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
